revised_title: A Critique of Newton's Color Theory and the Role of Refraction in Telescopic Lenses
tldr: The author critiques Newton's color theory, questioning the necessity of more than two colors (yellow and blue) to explain the composition of white light. They also challenge the idea that the difference in refraction always follows the same proportion in both large and small inclinations of rays on the surface, using telescopic lenses as an example.
